content.description: Steep and reachy through the first few bolts. Eases up with pockets and one final bulge to the anchor.
content.location: Shares start with Ewe People Suck, but goes straight up, heading slightly left instead of off to the right.

content.description: Crimpy start to pockets and bouldery bulge.
content.location: In between the thin black streak on the left and the thicker black streak on the right. Middle of the wall. Shares chains with Hey Ewe.

content.description: Shorter than the other routes down on this part of the Ewe Wall. Sustained crimps through.
content.location: Far left in the lower portion of Ewe Wall, just past the small alcove after Vagination Alcove. Left of the open project.

content.description: Listed in Goss' 2nd Ed guidebook showing a different ending. Ascend through some thin pockets and crimps away from then back to the arete as you get higher up towards the last couple of bolts. The last bolt is unseen from the ground and is set in over a hump just 3 feet below the anchors. From Todd's photo, this was listed as a "Project" and his topo showed it moving left to Plausible Deniability's lower anchors. IMO, it looks like the original intention was a different finish that would make for some very thin features going to PD's anchors. This is a good warm up for the thin and vertical neighboring 5.12s.
content.location: Immediately right of Plausible Deniability on the beginning (far left) of the Ewe Wall right before the gap between it and the Mutton Block. Start in the middle of some small trees up a sandy bank to the left of the Mutton block raised deck.

content.description: Thin crimps to hard bulge to chains.
content.location: Follow the left side of the thick black streak. Towards the right end of the wall.

content.description: Kind of a heady lead. Follow the easy start to a bouldery crux and big pockets to the finish.
content.location: The second route from the right side of the main Ewe Wall face.

content.description: Traverse pockets out left to the main face. Featured climbing on great holds to one minor roof pull.
content.location: The farthest left route once you make it on top of The Basement rock. Easily found by the belay bolt at the bottom.

content.description: Nice pockets and good edges to an overhung finish with minimal holds. Pulling the bulge gives it the grade.
Big ledges to a slightly overhung traverse. Finishes with Got-Ewe? to the left.
content.location: The farthest right on the main face at Ewe Wall. Shares anchors with Got-Ewe?

content.description: Crimpy slab through steep reachy headwall.
content.location: The first route to the right of the crack on the far right of the Ewe Wall. Separate from the other climbs.

content.description: Long climb that starts with a stem/chimney portion leading into big pockets.
content.location: The rightmost route on the Ewe Wall that starts in the lower canyon area of Lambs Knoll. Joins with Ewe-topia at bolt 7.

content.description: Beautiful pockets to bouldery bulge to chains.
content.location: Pretty much right in the middle of the wall - follow to the right of the thin black streak. Shares chains with Ewe-tah.

content.description: Steep and burly crimps lead to bigger holds and shared anchor.
content.location: The next route to the left of Ewe-carist. Shares start with Time's-a-wastin, but veers right instead of going straight up/to the left.

content.description: Start off slab, right of approach slot; access via the fixed rope. Steep pockets through the bulge to chains.
content.location: Right of the approach slot. Almost a different area from the main Ewe Wall.
